channel.title: [TUT]Ultimate SCAR Begginer\Intermediate's Guide!Please Read
channel.description:
[center][b] :cool: A SCAR BEGGINERS GUIDE :cool: [/b] _ :D I tried to cut it to the point, for noobs that dont like to read :D _ [b]-----------TABLE OF CONTENTS------------[/b] CHAPTER 1 - SYNTAX CHAPTER 2 - VARIABLES/CONSTANTS - HOW TO DEFINE THEM CHAPTER 3 - FUNCTIONS - FINDBITMAP - FINDCOLOR - INTTOSTR - STRTOINT - WAIT - CLICKMOUSE - SENDKEYS - RANDOMS - WRITELN - CLEARDEBUG - ISFKEYYDOWN - SENDKEYSVB - GETMOUSEPOS - MOVEMOUSE - HOLDMOUSE - RELEASEMOUSE - MOVEMOUSESMOOTH CHAPTER 4 - OTHER FUNCTIONS[NOT BUILT IN SCAR] - IsTextUp - Sendkeyshuman - InFight - FlagPresent - CheckChatMsg - Clickhuman - Takescreenshot CHAPTER 5 - Touchups(Make You Script User Friendly) - Reports - Forms (Go To Chapter 6) CHAPTER 6 - How To Add Forms/Get Them Running - Designing them - Adding them CHAPTER 7 - Making your own Procedures/Functions CHAPTER 8 - Some Script Tutorials - Autoclicker - Autotalker - Chicken Fighter(Coming Soon) CHAPTER 9 - ERRORS? SOLUTIONS HERE - Click [url=http://cruels.net/viewtopic.php?t=1560]HERE[/url] CHAPTER 10 - Run scar on 2+ Accounts - Click [url=http://cruels.net/viewtopic.php?t=1638]HERE[/url] [b]-----------------------------------------------[/b][/center] [center] [u][b]CHAPTER 1[/b][/u] - Syntax[/center] The Syntax Of Scar Is [code] program New; begin end. [/code] Name Your Program: [code]program New;[/code] Change "New" To Your Program Name Strings: And When Telling Scar What A String Is, You Put The Text Between ' ' as so in this example
str = 'Text in here'
[center] [u][b]CHAPTER 2[/b][/u] - VARIABLES/CONSTANTS[/center] [center][b]VARIABLES[/b][/center] [b]Strings:[/b] Defining them [code]var abc : string;[/code]when abc = your string variable name and use for this would be
abc := 'hi'
[b]Integer:[/b] Defining them [code]var i : integer;[/code]when i = your integer variable name these are all whole numbers positive or negative and use for this would be [code]i := 1 + 2[/code] and you may add other integers into it like this [code]i = i + 1[/code] or [code]i := num + 23[/code] Operators for ints. Multiply = * Divide = / Add = + Subtract = - [b]Extended:[/b] [code] var i : Extended;[/code]when i = your extended variable name these are decimals that are positive and negative and use is [code] i := i + 3.57[/code] [b]Boolean:[/b] [code] var bln : boolean;[/code] use [code]bln := True[/code] [center][b]Constants[/b][/center] Defining them [code]Const abc = 'hi'; i = 1; [/code] no defining types, that's it :D [center][u][b]CHAPTER 3[/b][/u] - Functions[/center] ok the basic functions to find color and bitmap are [code] FindColor(var x,y: Integer; Color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; FindBitmap(Bitmap: Integer; var x,y: Integer): Boolean;[/code] [center][b]FindColor:[/b][/center]
FindColor(var x,y: Integer; Color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; var x,y = u well put to variables in there, they will be returned as the value of the the x,y position. Color=Color your searching for, use the crosshairs to pick the color to get the number for that color and put it here xs=Top left corner in what u r searching in(x coordinate) ys=^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^(y coordinate) xe=Bottom Right corner in what u r searching in(x coordinate) ye=^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^(y coordinate) and if it is found it will return true so if(findcolor(x,y,21432,32,32,454,546)=True)then and so on. a little pick on the coords [code] (xs,ys)__________ | | | | | | |__________(xe,ye)[/code]
[center][b]Find Bitmap:[/b][/center]
FindBitmap(Bitmap: Integer; var x,y: Integer): Boolean; Bitmap=Picture u r looking for(lets explain this a bitmore) first to get the picture go to script -> picture to string, once u do that and selected a picture, it will return as a string, copy that ALL down. and define the variable, variable as in "hi" in hi = BitmapFromString('dsnfsanihbgfuhidahbygsxihdjfi') var x,y = u well put to variables in there, they will be returned as the value of the bitmap
[center][b]Inttostr:[/b][/center] This will allow you to put an integer into a string use [code]inttostr(i : integer) : string;[/code] something like this: [code]abc := inttostr(i)[/code] [center][b]Strtoint:[/b][/center] This will allow you to put an string into a integer use [code]strtoint(abc : string) : integer;[/code] something like this: [code]i := strtoint(abc)[/code] [center][b]Wait:[/b][/center] [code]wait(i : miliseconds);[/code] waits a certain num of milliseconds [code]wait(1000)[/code] that will wait for 1 second [center][b]Clickmouse:[/b][/center] [code]Clickmouse(var x,y:integer; left : boolean);[/code] will click at a certain position use [code]Clickmouse(45,45,True)[/code] that will left click at 45,45 to right click change True to false [center][b]Sendkeys:[/b][/center] [code]sendkeys(s : string);[/code] will send a letter(s) or word(s) use[code]sendkeys('hi')[/code] will type "hi", note, will type really fast. [center][b]Random:[/b][/center] [code]random(i : integer) : integer;[/code] will return random integer from the ranger you selected say you put 6 will return random integer from 0-5, or 0,1,2,3,4,5(will choose one), or say random(6) + 1 will return from 1 - 6 use[code]random(6)[/code] [center][b]Writeln:[/b][/center] [code]Writeln(s : string);[/code] will put text in debug box use[code]Writeln('hi')[/code] [center][b]Cleardebug:[/b][/center] will clear debug use[code]Cleardebug;[/code] [center][b]IsFKeyDown[/b][/center] will return true if fkey is down use[code]if isfkeydown(1)=true then[/code] and so on. [center][b]SendKeysVb:[/b][/center] mostly used for enter.[code] SendKeysVb('{ENTER}',false)[/code] [center][b]Getmousepos:[/b][/center] will return x and y as the mouse pos [code]Getmousepos(x,y)[/code] [center][b]Movemouse:[/b][/center] will movemouse to coords [code]Movemouse(x,y)[/code] [center][b]HOLDMOUSE:[/b][/center] will hold left or right down starting at x,y [code]Holdmouse(x,y,true)[/code] TRUE FOR LEFT CLICK FALSE FOR RIGHT [center] [b]RELEASEMOUSE:[/b][/center] will release left or right down starting at x,y (use with holdmouse function) [code]releasemouse(x,y,true)[/code] TRUE FOR LEFT CLICK FALSE FOR RIGHT [center][b]MoveMouseSmooth[/b][/center] moves mouse like human. self explanatoy like everything else use[code]movemousesmooth(45,45)[/code] [center][u][b]CHAPTER 4[/b][/u] - OTHER FUNCTIONS [From squig][If This is againts the rules, please remove this chapter] [b]IsTextUp:[/b][/center] This will check if the text is in the corner of the rs window, like Attack or Mine Or Take [code] Function IsTextAt3(x, y : Integer; S : String; Tolerance : Integer) : Boolean; Var a, b : Integer; Begin result:= IsTextInAreaEx(x - 2, y - 2, x + 2, y + 2, a, b, S, Tolerance, ChrCharsNormal, True, False, 0, 1, -1); End; Function IsTextUp(text : String) : Boolean; Begin result:= IsTextAt3(9, 9, text, 100);//reads text in corner of rs End; begin ChrCharsNormal:= LoadChars2(AppPath + 'Charsrs22\'); //Loads rs characters from bitmaps end. [/code] use [code] if IsTextUp('Attack') = true then [/code] [center][b]Sendkeyshuman:[/b][/center] will send keys like a human would. [code] Procedure SendKeysHuman(text:String); Var a1 : Integer; Begin a1:= 1; Repeat wait(random(220) + 15); sendkeys(copy(text, a1, 1)); a1:= a1 + 1; Until a1 > length(text); End; [/code] Use is self explanitory if your reading this tutorial. [center][b]In Fight?:[/b][/center] [code] Function InFight : Boolean; Var a, b : Integer; Begin If(findcolorspiral(a, b, 16728128, 215, 115, 330, 185)) Or(findcolorspiral(a, b, 192, 215, 115, 330, 185))Then If(Poisoned= false)And(diseased= false)Then result:= true; End; [/code]This Will Return True If You In A Fight: [code]if InFight = True Then[/code] and so on. [center] [b]FlagPresent[/b][/center] Checks if the flag is present on the minimap. [code] Function FlagPresent : Boolean; Var a, b, runescapeflag, runescapeflag2 : Integer; Begin result:= false; runescapeflag := BitmapFromString(7, 7, 'z78DA3330200CDCDC' + '8855835F25B21A5C2A31D560AAC4A50659257E35A49200AE7D3BF' + '1'); runescapeflag2 := BitmapFromstring(2, 4, 'C656045D3311C656045D3311C656045D3311C656045D3311'); If(findbitmapin(runescapeflag, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160)) Or(findbitmapin(runescapeflag2, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))Then Begin wait(50); If(findbitmapin(runescapeflag, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160)) Or(findbitmapin(runescapeflag2, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))Then result:=true; End; FreeBitmap(runescapeflag); FreeBitmap(runescapeflag2); End; [/code] to check if it is present [code]if Flagpresent = true then[/code]... and so on. [center][b]Checkchatmsg[/b][/center] Checks last message in the chatbox and sees if it is the same as what u specified. [code] Function CheckChatMsg(Text: String) : Boolean; Begin Result:= IsTextAtEx(20, 415, Text, 40, ChrChatChars, False, True, 0, 1, 0); End; [/code] [center] [b]Clickhuman[/b][/center] [code] Procedure ClickHuman(x, y : Integer; left : Boolean); Begin holdmouse(x, y, left); wait(random(20) + 15); releasemouse(x, y, left); End; [/code] [center][b]Takescreenshot[/b][/center] [code] Procedure TakeScreenShot(reason:String; number:Integer); Begin SaveScreenshot(apppath + 'scripts\' + reason + inttostr(number) + '.bmp'); writeln('Screenshot taken: ' + reason + ' #' + inttostr(number)); End; [/code] [center][center][u][b]CHAPTER 5[/b][/u] - Touch ups[/center] Reports:[/center] Use reports so user's can see what the script has been doing. a report script would look something like this. [code] Procedure report; begin writeln('This is my Autominer') writeln('Mined: ' + inttostr(numrocksmined)) writeln('End Report') end; [/code] this is a example of a simple report. [center][u][b]CHAPTER 6[/b][/u] - Making User Forms(for advanced)[/center] 1.Open Scar 2.Tools -> Form Editor... [img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/3457/menu1sa.png[/img] 3.Click and drag a button on the form. [img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/6232/buttonclick0hb.png[/img] and[img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/7218/dragonform4na.png[/img] 4.Save Form [img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/5376/save5hx.png[/img] 5.Loadform [img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/249/loadform1bu.png[/img] 6.Stuff should appear in the debug box. 7.Delete Whats Is In scar(Program New; Begin End; Etc) 8.And Copy the stuff that appeared in the debug and paste it in the script. [img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/1717/copypastebody9su.png[/img] Put those between Proecdure tags [code] Procedure Form1; begin //stuff here end;[/code] 9.And Copy The Variables At The Bottom Of The Debug Box To The Top Of You Script. [img]http://img107.imageshack.us/img107/4135/vars8na.png[/img] 10.Add this Button on click thingy in the stuff in the script [img]http://img131.imageshack.us/img131/8545/buttononclick9wm.png[/img] 11.And Define this Procedure: [img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/787/onclickprocedure5wc.png[/img] 12.And At The Bottom of you script put this: [code] procedure SafeInitForm; var v: TVariantArray; begin setarraylength(V, 0); ThreadSafeCall('Form1', v); //Replace Form1 with the Procedure name you put the stuff between. end; procedure ShowFormModal; begin frmDesign.ShowModal; //Replace frmDesign with the name of your form end; procedure SafeShowFormModal; var v: TVariantArray; begin setarraylength(V, 0); ThreadSafeCall('ShowFormModal', v); end;[/code] 13. And At The Bottom add [code] begin SafeInitForm; SafeShowFormModal; end. [/code] 14. When Finished: [code] program New; var frmDesign : TForm; Button1 : TButton; procedure buttonclick(sender: TObject); begin Writeln('Button pressed!'); frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + '.'; frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk; end; procedure InitForm; begin frmDesign := CreateForm; frmDesign.Left := 259; frmDesign.Top := 132; frmDesign.Width := 354; frmDesign.Height := 254; frmDesign.Caption := 'frmDesign'; frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace; frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText; frmDesign.Font.Height := -11; frmDesign.Font.Name := 'MS Sans Serif'; frmDesign.Font.Style := []; frmDesign.Visible := False; frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96; Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign); Button1.OnClick:= @buttonclick; Button1.Parent := frmDesign; Button1.Left := 69; Button1.Top := 61; Button1.Width := 75; Button1.Height := 25; Button1.Caption := 'Button1'; Button1.TabOrder := 8; end; procedure SafeInitForm; var v: TVariantArray; begin setarraylength(V, 0); ThreadSafeCall('InitForm', v); end; procedure ShowFormModal; begin frmDesign.ShowModal; end; procedure SafeShowFormModal; var v: TVariantArray; begin setarraylength(V, 0); ThreadSafeCall('ShowFormModal', v); end; begin SafeInitForm; SafeShowFormModal; end. [/code] 15. For More Info, on scar, press f1, or go to help->help, and scroll to the bottom of that page. [center][u][b]CHAPTER 7[/b][/u] - Making Procedures/Functions[/center] [center]Procedures - Runs a certain code, like clickmouse or writeln[/center] Basic Syntax [code] Procedure Show; begin end; [/code] or you can have them enter info [code] Procedure Fight(colorofprey : integer; eatfood : boolean); begin writeln('Looking for ' + inttostr(colorofprey)) //not really a fight function, just an example. end; [/code] [center]Functions - returns values or booleans like findcolor = true or find bitmap[/center] Basic Syntax [code] Function belowten(num : integer) : boolean; begin result:= false; if(num < 10)then result:= true; end; [/code] [center][u][b]CHAPTER 8[/b][/u] - Making Your Own Scripts(Tuts)[/center] [center][b]Autoclicker:[/b][/center] [code] program Autoclicker; Const Betweentime = 1; //Wait between each click in seconds. var x,y:integer; begin repeat getmousepos(x,y); clickmouse(x,y,True); wait((Betweentime * 1000) + random(300)) until(false) end.[/code] Ok We Put The Code Between Repeat and until(false) so this will run forever until the user stops it. ok in the wait between each click we put [code]wait((Betweentime * 1000) + random(300))[/code] between time is what the user wants to wait before clicks, we times it by 1000 to convert it to milliseconds, and we put random(300) milliseconds to make it more human like. that is pretty much it. [center] [b]Autotalker:[/b][/center] [code] program Autotalker; Const Whattosay = 'Hiyah';//What to type F1 begin repeat if(IsFKeyDown(1))then begin sendkeys(Whattosay); SendKeysVb('{ENTER}',false); end; wait(300);//Keeps it from saying it more than once on one simple click, //remove this and press f1 too see what i mean. until(false) end.[/code] Selfexplanatory. IsFKeyDown Checks to see if the fkey is down. [center][u][b]CHAPTER 9[/b][/u] - ERRORS? SOLUTIONS HERE[/center] Srry but u will have to register to use this. - Click [url=http://cruels.net/viewtopic.php?t=1560]HERE[/url] [center][u][b]CHAPTER 10[/b][/u] - Run scar on 2+ Accounts[/center] - Click [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3082.0.html]Here[/url] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- THANK YOU FOR READING THIS FAR, THATS THE END OF MY TUTORIAL, I WILL ADD STUFF ON REQUEST, JUST POST HERE. NOTE: DONT REQUEST SCRIPTS HERE! AS THAT SAID, I WILL CONSIDER IT AS SPAM!

item.title: [TUT]Ultimate SCAR Begginer\Intermediate's Guide!Please Read
item.dc:creator: @The_Rs_Monkey The_Rs_Monkey
item.description:
@The_Rs_Monkey wrote:

[center] A SCAR BEGGINERS GUIDE
_ I tried to cut it to the point, for noobs that dont like to read _

-----------TABLE OF CONTENTS------------
CHAPTER 1 - SYNTAX
CHAPTER 2 - VARIABLES/CONSTANTS

  • HOW TO DEFINE THEM
    CHAPTER 3 - FUNCTIONS
  • FINDBITMAP
  • FINDCOLOR
  • INTTOSTR
  • STRTOINT
  • WAIT
  • CLICKMOUSE
  • SENDKEYS
  • RANDOMS
  • WRITELN
  • CLEARDEBUG
  • ISFKEYYDOWN
  • SENDKEYSVB
  • GETMOUSEPOS
  • MOVEMOUSE
  • HOLDMOUSE
  • RELEASEMOUSE
  • MOVEMOUSESMOOTH
    CHAPTER 4 - OTHER FUNCTIONS[NOT BUILT IN SCAR]
  • IsTextUp
  • Sendkeyshuman
  • InFight
  • FlagPresent
  • CheckChatMsg
  • Clickhuman
  • Takescreenshot
    CHAPTER 5 - Touchups(Make You Script User Friendly)
  • Reports
  • Forms (Go To Chapter 6)
    CHAPTER 6 - How To Add Forms/Get Them Running
  • Designing them
  • Adding them
    CHAPTER 7 - Making your own Procedures/Functions
    CHAPTER 8 - Some Script Tutorials
  • Autoclicker
  • Autotalker
  • Chicken Fighter(Coming Soon)
    CHAPTER 9 - ERRORS? SOLUTIONS HERE
  • Click HERE
    CHAPTER 10 - Run scar on 2+ Accounts
  • Click HERE
    -----------------------------------------------[/center]

[center]
CHAPTER 1 - Syntax[/center]
The Syntax Of Scar Is

program New;
begin
end.

Name Your Program:

program New;

Change “New” To Your Program Name

Strings:
And When Telling Scar What A String Is, You Put The Text Between ’ ’ as so in this example

str = 'Text in here'
[center] [u][b]CHAPTER 2[/b][/u] - VARIABLES/CONSTANTS[/center]

[center]VARIABLES[/center]
Strings:
Defining them

var abc : string;when abc = your string variable name

and use for this would be

abc := ‘hi’

Integer:
Defining them

var i : integer;when i = your integer variable name
these are all whole numbers positive or negative

and use for this would be i := 1 + 2 and you may add other integers into it like this i = i + 1 or i := num + 23
Operators for ints.
Multiply = *
Divide = /
Add = +
Subtract = -

Extended:

var i : Extended;when i = your extended variable name
these are decimals that are positive and negative

and use is i := i + 3.57
Boolean:

var bln : boolean;

use bln := True

[center]Constants[/center]
Defining them

Const abc = 'hi'; i = 1; no defining types, that’s it

[center]CHAPTER 3 - Functions[/center]

ok the basic functions to find color and bitmap are

FindColor(var x,y: Integer; Color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; FindBitmap(Bitmap: Integer; var x,y: Integer): Boolean;

[center]FindColor:[/center]

FindColor(var x,y: Integer; Color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; var x,y = u well put to variables in there, they will be returned as the value of the the x,y position. Color=Color your searching for, use the crosshairs to pick the color to get the number for that color and put it here xs=Top left corner in what u r searching in(x coordinate) ys=^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^(y coordinate) xe=Bottom Right corner in what u r searching in(x coordinate) ye=^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^(y coordinate) and if it is found it will return true so if(findcolor(x,y,21432,32,32,454,546)=True)then and so on. a little pick on the coords [code] (xs,ys)__________ | | | | | | |__________(xe,ye)[/code]

[center]Find Bitmap:[/center]

FindBitmap(Bitmap: Integer; var x,y: Integer): Boolean;

Bitmap=Picture u r looking for(lets explain this a bitmore)
first to get the picture go to script -> picture to string, once u do that and selected a picture, it will return as a string, copy that ALL down. and define the variable, variable as in “hi” in hi = BitmapFromString(‘dsnfsanihbgfuhidahbygsxihdjfi’)
var x,y = u well put to variables in there, they will be returned as the value of the bitmap

[center]Inttostr:[/center]

This will allow you to put an integer into a string
use

inttostr(i : integer) : string;

something like this:

abc := inttostr(i)

[center]Strtoint:[/center]

This will allow you to put an string into a integer
use

strtoint(abc : string) : integer;

something like this:

i := strtoint(abc)

[center]Wait:[/center]

wait(i : miliseconds);

waits a certain num of milliseconds

wait(1000)

that will wait for 1 second

[center]Clickmouse:[/center]

Clickmouse(var x,y:integer; left : boolean);

will click at a certain position
use Clickmouse(45,45,True)
that will left click at 45,45
to right click change True to false

[center]Sendkeys:[/center]

sendkeys(s : string);

will send a letter(s) or word(s)
usesendkeys('hi')
will type “hi”, note, will type really fast.

[center]Random:[/center]

random(i : integer) : integer;

will return random integer from the ranger you selected
say you put 6
will return random integer from 0-5, or 0,1,2,3,4,5(will choose one), or say random(6) + 1 will return from 1 - 6
userandom(6)

[center]Writeln:[/center]

Writeln(s : string);

will put text in debug box
useWriteln('hi')

[center]Cleardebug:[/center]

will clear debug
useCleardebug;

[center]IsFKeyDown[/center]
will return true if fkey is down
useif isfkeydown(1)=true then and so on.

[center]SendKeysVb:[/center]
mostly used for enter. SendKeysVb('{ENTER}',false)

[center]Getmousepos:[/center]
will return x and y as the mouse pos

Getmousepos(x,y)

[center]Movemouse:[/center]
will movemouse to coords

Movemouse(x,y)

[center]HOLDMOUSE:[/center]
will hold left or right down starting at x,y

Holdmouse(x,y,true)

TRUE FOR LEFT CLICK
FALSE FOR RIGHT
[center]
RELEASEMOUSE:[/center]
will release left or right down starting at x,y (use with holdmouse function)

releasemouse(x,y,true)

TRUE FOR LEFT CLICK
FALSE FOR RIGHT

[center]MoveMouseSmooth[/center]
moves mouse like human.
self explanatoy like everything else
usemovemousesmooth(45,45)

[center]CHAPTER 4 - OTHER FUNCTIONS
[From squig][If This is againts the rules, please remove this chapter]
IsTextUp:[/center]

This will check if the text is in the corner of the rs window, like Attack or Mine Or Take


 Function IsTextAt3(x, y : Integer; S : String; Tolerance : Integer) : Boolean;
Var
  a, b : Integer;
Begin
  result:= IsTextInAreaEx(x - 2, y - 2, x + 2, y + 2, a, b, S, Tolerance, ChrCharsNormal, True, False, 0, 1, -1);
End;

Function IsTextUp(text : String) : Boolean;
Begin
  result:= IsTextAt3(9, 9, text, 100);//reads text in corner of rs
End; 

begin
ChrCharsNormal:= LoadChars2(AppPath  +  'Charsrs22\'); //Loads rs characters from bitmaps
end.

use if IsTextUp('Attack') = true then

[center]Sendkeyshuman:[/center]
will send keys like a human would.

Procedure SendKeysHuman(text:String); Var a1 : Integer; Begin a1:= 1; Repeat wait(random(220) + 15); sendkeys(copy(text, a1, 1)); a1:= a1 + 1; Until a1 > length(text); End; Use is self explanitory if your reading this tutorial.

[center]In Fight?:[/center]

Function InFight : Boolean; Var a, b : Integer; Begin If(findcolorspiral(a, b, 16728128, 215, 115, 330, 185)) Or(findcolorspiral(a, b, 192, 215, 115, 330, 185))Then If(Poisoned= false)And(diseased= false)Then result:= true; End; This Will Return True If You In A Fight:

if InFight = True Then and so on.
[center]
FlagPresent[/center]
Checks if the flag is present on the minimap.

Function FlagPresent : Boolean;
Var
  a, b, runescapeflag, runescapeflag2 : Integer;
Begin
  result:= false;
  runescapeflag := BitmapFromString(7, 7, 'z78DA3330200CDCDC' +
       '8855835F25B21A5C2A31D560AAC4A50659257E35A49200AE7D3BF' +
       '1');
  runescapeflag2 :=  BitmapFromstring(2, 4,
       'C656045D3311C656045D3311C656045D3311C656045D3311');
  If(findbitmapin(runescapeflag, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))
  Or(findbitmapin(runescapeflag2, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))Then
    Begin
      wait(50);
      If(findbitmapin(runescapeflag, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))
      Or(findbitmapin(runescapeflag2, a, b, 555, 5, 735, 160))Then
        result:=true;
    End;
  FreeBitmap(runescapeflag);
  FreeBitmap(runescapeflag2);
End;

to check if it is present if Flagpresent = true then… and so on.

[center]Checkchatmsg[/center]
Checks last message in the chatbox and sees if it is the same as what u specified.

Function CheckChatMsg(Text: String) : Boolean;
Begin
  Result:= IsTextAtEx(20, 415, Text, 40, ChrChatChars, False, True, 0, 1, 0);
End;

[center]
Clickhuman[/center]

Procedure ClickHuman(x, y : Integer; left : Boolean);
Begin
  holdmouse(x, y, left);
  wait(random(20) + 15);
  releasemouse(x, y, left);
End;

[center]Takescreenshot[/center]

Procedure TakeScreenShot(reason:String; number:Integer);
Begin
  SaveScreenshot(apppath + 'scripts\' + reason + inttostr(number) + '.bmp');
  writeln('Screenshot taken: ' + reason + ' #' + inttostr(number));
End;

[center][center]CHAPTER 5 - Touch ups[/center]
Reports:[/center]
Use reports so user’s can see what the script has been doing.
a report script would look something like this.

Procedure report;
begin
writeln('This is my Autominer')
writeln('Mined: ' + inttostr(numrocksmined))
writeln('End Report')
end;

this is a example of a simple report.

[center]CHAPTER 6 - Making User Forms(for advanced)[/center]
1.Open Scar
2.Tools -> Form Editor…

3.Click and drag a button on the form.

and
4.Save Form

5.Loadform

6.Stuff should appear in the debug box.
7.Delete Whats Is In scar(Program New; Begin End; Etc)
8.And Copy the stuff that appeared in the debug and paste it in the script.

Put those between Proecdure tags

Procedure Form1; begin //stuff here end;
9.And Copy The Variables At The Bottom Of The Debug Box To The Top Of You Script.

10.Add this Button on click thingy in the stuff in the script

11.And Define this Procedure:

12.And At The Bottom of you script put this:

[code]
procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘Form1’, v);
//Replace Form1 with the Procedure name you put the stuff between.
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
//Replace frmDesign with the name of your form
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;[/code]
13. And At The Bottom add

begin
  SafeInitForm;
  SafeShowFormModal;
end.
  1. When Finished:
program New;
var
  frmDesign : TForm;
  Button1 : TButton;

procedure buttonclick(sender: TObject);
begin
  Writeln('Button pressed!');
  frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + '.';
  frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin
  frmDesign := CreateForm;
  frmDesign.Left := 259;
  frmDesign.Top := 132;
  frmDesign.Width := 354;
  frmDesign.Height := 254;
  frmDesign.Caption := 'frmDesign';
  frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
  frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
  frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
  frmDesign.Font.Name := 'MS Sans Serif';
  frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
  frmDesign.Visible := False;
  frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
  Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
  Button1.OnClick:= @buttonclick;
  Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
  Button1.Left := 69;
  Button1.Top := 61;
  Button1.Width := 75;
  Button1.Height := 25;
  Button1.Caption := 'Button1';
  Button1.TabOrder := 8;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
  v: TVariantArray;
begin
  setarraylength(V, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('InitForm', v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
  frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
  v: TVariantArray;
begin
  setarraylength(V, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('ShowFormModal', v);
end;

begin
  SafeInitForm;
  SafeShowFormModal;
end.
  1. For More Info, on scar, press f1, or go to help->help, and scroll to the bottom of that page.

[center]CHAPTER 7 - Making Procedures/Functions[/center]
[center]Procedures - Runs a certain code, like clickmouse or writeln[/center]
Basic Syntax

Procedure Show;
begin
end;

or you can have them enter info

Procedure Fight(colorofprey : integer; eatfood : boolean);
begin
writeln('Looking for ' + inttostr(colorofprey))
//not really a fight function, just an example.
end;

[center]Functions - returns values or booleans like findcolor = true or find bitmap[/center]
Basic Syntax

Function belowten(num : integer) : boolean;
begin
result:= false;
if(num < 10)then
result:= true;
end;

[center]CHAPTER 8 - Making Your Own Scripts(Tuts)[/center]
[center]Autoclicker:[/center]

program Autoclicker; Const Betweentime = 1; //Wait between each click in seconds. var x,y:integer; begin repeat getmousepos(x,y); clickmouse(x,y,True); wait((Betweentime * 1000) + random(300)) until(false) end.
Ok We Put The Code Between Repeat and until(false) so this will run forever until the user stops it.
ok in the wait between each click we put wait((Betweentime * 1000) + random(300))
between time is what the user wants to wait before clicks, we times it by 1000 to convert it to milliseconds, and we put random(300) milliseconds to make it more human like. that is pretty much it.
[center]
Autotalker:[/center]

program Autotalker; Const Whattosay = 'Hiyah';//What to type F1 begin repeat if(IsFKeyDown(1))then begin sendkeys(Whattosay); SendKeysVb('{ENTER}',false); end; wait(300);//Keeps it from saying it more than once on one simple click, //remove this and press f1 too see what i mean. until(false) end.
Selfexplanatory. IsFKeyDown Checks to see if the fkey is down.
